title.narrative: Disability Rights

description.narrative: Paraguayans with disabilities are often the most excluded members of society and do not have equal access to economic and civic opportunities. Fundacin Saraki (Saraki) partners with organizations to develop leadership and promotional skills to uphold laws that further the rights of people with disabilities like equal opportunity in employment. At the IAF we support community-led solutions to strengthen governance in Paraguay. Saraki's activities strengthen excluded communities so they can participate equally in political economic and social life.

title.narrative: Disability Rights

description.narrative: Fundacin Saraki (Saraki) will work with 50 grassroots and nongovernmental organizations in 11 departments to develop leadership and advocacy skills toward the enforcement of laws protecting the rights of Paraguayans with disabilities, including the right to equal opportunity in employment. The coalition will offer training in job skills and will also educate the public. The project is expected to benefit 1,960 Paraguayans directly and 900,000 indirectly.

The project will directly benefit 3,600 indigenous Paraguayans in the communities served and will indirectly benefit 6,000 other indigenous Paraguayans.

title.narrative: Agriculture/Food Production Grant

description.narrative: Grupo Sun (Sun) will train Angait and Av Guaran indigenous communities in gardening and animal husbandry toreach their goal of food security, Sun will also train the communities in ways to generate incometo improve their quality of life. An external evaluator will document their intercultural approach and how it contributes to stronger community cohesion and organization, and greater advocacy, economic, social and political opportunities for indigenous Paraguayans.

The project will benefit 250 young Paraguayans directly and 30,000 others indirectly.

title.narrative: Agriculture/Food Production Grant

description.narrative: OGUASU will train 1,000 Myba Paraguayans in the organic cultivation of traditional crops, reforestation, conservation, beekeeping, aquaculture and animal husbandry and offer workshops in leadership and indigenous rights. Participants will also develop a weekly radio program.

title.narrative: Agriculture/Food Production Grant

description.narrative: Asociacin de Productores Orgnicos (APRO) will increase incomes and improve the quality of life of approximately 290 families by strengthening its capacity to market and sell fresh and processed agricultural products. It will also provide technical assistance and training on organic production. APRO's goals are to increase the association's sales volume, diversify and expand its product base to include new value- added products and grow organic fruits and vegetables off- season. The project will directly benefit 1000 individuals as well as another 1820 indirectly.

title.narrative: A Partnership to Pilot an Indicator Framework for Sustainable Agriculture in Latin America

description.narrative: Farmers are often absent from discussions about how policies and programs impact sustainable agricultural production. At the IAF, we are investing in a regional effort, in conjunction with the University of British Columbia, that will give voice to farmers and directly support them in collecting, analyzing, and presenting data that they can incorporate into their operations to manage their farms more efficiently. Asociacin de Productores Orgnicos (APRO) established the first recognized participatory certification system in Paraguay and is connecting producers directly to consumers to increase farmers incomes and consumers food security. It provides training and technical assistance programs to provide high-quality certified organic products to national and international consumers. The results of this regional project will inform agricultural support organizations, government extension experts, farmer groups, and policy-makers with context-specific data about how to encourage the transition to sustainable agricultural practices to improve food security, enhance farmer livelihoods, and minimize environmental degradation. This is part of the IAFs strategic initiative for sustainable agriculture.

Approximately 1,500 people will benefit directly and 5,200 people will benefit indirectly.

title.narrative: Training in Agroecological Culture for the Rooting of the Indigenous Pa Tavytera of the Amamabay

description.narrative: Illicit activities and the lack of jobs in Paraguay's Concepcin Department hinder economic and community development. Asociacin Pa Tavytera RekoPave (APTR) helps indigenous families especially women and young people improve organic agricultural production cultivate traditional crops and develop a more reliable food supply. At the IAF we support community-led solutions to expand economic development in Paraguay. APTR's activities promote smallholder agriculture and food production to enhance food security and ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive.

title.narrative: Improving food security and income through organic agriculture, animal husbandry, and beekeeping in Itapa

description.narrative: ESCAP will work with families in Natalio and Yatytay in Itapa department of southeast Paraguay to improve their food security and income through organic gardens and enhanced dairy cattle poultry and honey production. Farmers will diversify their production and improve market access through training and upgrades to facilities to store their goods while in transit to fairs for examples. Project activities will also strengthen ESCAP's management skills to help it help it function more efficiently and effectively. ESCAP will also work with a regional alliance of organizations it is part of to organize training workshops to increase its members' fundraising and networking skills and improve overall operations. ESCAP will also work through its member organizations to help install water systems in two communities to increase access to potable water. The grant will benefit 384 individuals directly and another 5200 individuals indirectly.

title.narrative: Enterprise Development Grant

description.narrative: Estacion A will train 176 men and women to design and produce anduti lace, weavings from palm fiber, pottery, and woodcarvings and market their products in Paraguay and abroad. It will also organize events and tours that coincide with local festivals as well develop networks led by craftspeople to promote their products and services.

title.narrative: Enterprise Development Grant

It will also organize events and tours that coincide with local festivals as well develop networks led by craftspeople to promote their products and services.

title.narrative: Enterprise Development Grant

description.narrative: Estacin A-Nucleo Cultural (Estacin A) will expand the number of individual artisans and groups it helps with design improvements and product quality, develop marketing strategies, and expand participation in fairs and similar events. Estacin A will operate a working capital fund to expand sales, in particular taking advantage of public and private sector procurement programs, including Corporate Social Responsibility programs. It will also work with youths to develop several tourism circuits and launch complementary artisan and cultural enterprises.

title.narrative: Agriculture/Food Production Grant

description.narrative: Alter Vida in Paraguay will work in tandem with the small dairy cooperative Ciervo Cu to increase their members' income by improving their production, their ability to negotiate with their clients for better prices and their advocacy to their local government for better services. The members will also begin the transition from conventional to "agroecological" practices that improve food security and protect the environment. The project will benefit 500 Paraguayans directly and another 1,500 indirectly.

title.narrative: Agriculture/Food Production Grant

description.narrative: Members of the dairy cooperative Cooperativa Ciervo Cu (Ciervo Cu), in Paraguay, will work with Alter Vida to develop a more reliable food supply and increase their income by improving their production and their organization. The project should benefit 500 families in the community of Ciervo Cu-San Francisco directly and another 1,500 residents indirectly.

title.narrative: Agriculture/Food Production Grant

description.narrative: Asociacin Sombra de rbol in Paraguay (ASdeA) will provide technical assistance and training that enables two indigenous communities and a creole producer association in the Paraguayan Chaco to develop a more reliable food supply and the ability to advocate for their interests, defend their rights to their territory, practice their culture, increase awareness of their contributions to Paraguayan society, participate in local and regional networks, and organize more effectively. The work will benefit 850 Paraguayans directly and 10,500 indirectly.

title.narrative: Cultural Expression Grant

description.narrative: Mingar Asociacin para el Desarrollo Sustentable in Paraguay will offer eight organizations of indigenous artisans training and technical assistance toward improving their members' handicraft production and marketing, developing public awareness of Paraguay's indigenous heritage and creating opportunities for the growth of community tourism. It will also facilitate dialogue among artisans of various ethnicities, civil society organizations and the public sector on how best to take advantage of the crafts traditions to improve the quality of life of indigenous communities. The work will benefit 320 artisans directly and another 1,600 Paraguayans indirectly.

Some 250 Paraguayans should benefit directly and another 1,000 indirectly.

Its training should enable residents to exercise their rights as indigenous Paraguayans, develop their organizations, secure their food supply, access water resources, and address the effects of climate change. Approximately 360 Nivacle and Manjui Paraguayans should benefit directly and another 3,200 indirectly.

title.narrative: IMPROVEMENT OF PLATFORM CAPABILITIES: PY ORGANIC

description.narrative: Small farmers in rural Paraguay often lack access to markets to sell their goods limiting their potential to generate income. The IAF supports community-led approaches to expand economic opportunity. Our grantee partner Paraguay Orgnico (PY Orgnico) helps small farmer organizations break into and benefit from expanding organic markets. This grant will allow PY Orgnico to extend its efforts on three fronts: train farmers to differentiate their products connect farmers to potential markets and strengthen its own organizational capacities. As a result farmers will be better prepared to meet evolving market requirements and PY Orgnico will be an even stronger partner going forward.

title.narrative: Strengthening of the Paraguayan Organization of Conservation and Sustainable Development - OPADES and expansion of the Program of Volunteers in Protected Areas to the Reserve of Managed Resources Yvytyruz, Dpto. Del Guaira

description.narrative: OPADES- Paraguay. Paraguay, with one of the highest deforestation rates in the world, is home to the diverse Yvytyruz reserve. Communities living within the reserve face extreme poverty and are often unaware of the lands protected status, resulting in similarly high rates of deforestation. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to expand economic opportunity and promote sustainable natural resource management. Our grantee partner, Organizacin Paraguaya de Conservacin y Desarrollo Sustentable (OPADES), offers environmental education, leadership, and entrepreneurship training opportunities to youth in the Yvytyruz reserve to bolster environmental stewardship and improve livelihoods.

title.narrative: Gobernanza Territorial Indgena para el Desarrollo Autodeterminado y la Accin Climtica

description.narrative: With Paraguays Atlantic Forest facing extinction from deforestation and devastating fires, preserving and restoring forest reserves on indigenous lands has become critical. The Mby Guaran community faces ongoing incursions on its constitutionally-granted lands in the Atlantic Forest of the Upper Paran. The COVID-19 pandemic and resulting economic contraction have further increased the pressure on Indigenous Paraguayans to diversify their economic activities while maintaining a sustainable approach to land management. The Federacin para la Autodeterminacin de los Pueblos Indgenas (FAPI) is an association of Paraguayan Indigenous groups that advocates for their territorial rights and supports communities to identify sustainable approaches to managing their territory. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to improving environmental management and strengthening local governance. FAPI will support local Mby Guaran groups to develop and implement a land management plan to protect against forest fires and promote their territorial autonomy.

title.narrative: eha' corrupcin opa haua

description.narrative: Ciudad del Este, Paraguays second largest city, has received more than $12 million in education funding from a national development fund. By engaging actively with the process for allocating those funds, residents of Ciudad del Este can ensure the allocations are distributed in a manner that maximizes their impact. ReAccin, a youth-led organization, works to educate students, parents, and school administrators about the educational funding process. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to engaging citizens, combating corruption, and ensuring sustainable local funding of development initiatives. Through this grant, ReAccin will develop internet-based tools to promote student activism and expand investigative journalism so that Paraguayans better understand funding allocations in their country..

title.narrative: Fortalecimiento socio-empresarial y productivo de la Asociacin de la Agricultura Agroecolgica del Paraguay - Ooir

description.narrative: Pesticide runoff contaminates waterways and reduces the productivity of small-scale farms in Paraguay. When farmers cannot grow enough crops to make a living, they may feel pressured to migrate, rent, or sell their land. The IAF supports community-led approaches to sustainable agriculture and income generation. Our grantee, Ooir? is supporting farmers to increase production of organic yerba mate, a traditional beverage in Paraguay and neighboring countries, and expand sales both nationally and internationally. Ooir? is also diversifying into a new product line of organic medicinal plants, such as stevia and lemon verbena, grown and sold by women smallholder producers. This grant is part of the IAFs Women INvesting in Growth and Security (WINGS) initiative to empower women as business and community leaders.

title.narrative: Fortaleciendo la capacidad de produccin agroecolgica de agricultoras familiares de 3 Distritos del Departamento de San Pedro

description.narrative: Many women smallholder farmers in San Pedro, one of the poorest departments in Paraguay, face the challenge of having to farm with contaminated water and soil and limited access to markets for their products. Local public policies relevant to sustainable agriculture often fail to reflect womens needs or aspirations because they are often excluded from the development of policies. The IAF supports community-led approaches to increase income generation and civic participation. Our grantee Coordinadora Departamental de Mujeres de San Pedro (CDMSP) supports women smallholder producers in adopting sustainable agricultural practices that help them expand food production for consumption and sale. CDMSP also builds women farmers capacity to advocate for their interests with local governments. This grant is part of the IAFs Women INvesting in Growth and Security (WINGS) initiative to empower women as business and community leaders. title.narrative: Tri-border Intercultural and Institutional Integration Mechanism

description.narrative: Indigenous Mbya Guarani communities in Paraguay rely on farming and wage labor as their former hunting and gathering livelihoods became unviable. They experience low levels of socioeconomic development, including food insecurity, that have worsened during the COVID-19 pandemic. The IAF supports community-led approaches to strengthen resilience through sustainable agriculture and income generation. Our grantee Oguasu supports the Mbya Guarani in Paraguay in implementing sustainable agricultural practices and learning skilled trades in order to increase their families incomes and food security. Oguasu will also foster a network of Indigenous-led organizations across the Mbya Guarani territory, which crosses Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, and Paraguay, to promote topics related to the exercise of human rights and economic inclusion. This grant is part of the IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

title.narrative: Escuela de emprendedoras refugiadas y migrantes

description.narrative: In recent years, Paraguay has been receiving many more refugees and migrants displaced by the ongoing crisis in Venezuela in recent years in 2020 alone, requests for asylum nearly doubled. Displaced Venezuelans often face legal, social, and economic barriers to establishing livelihoods for themselves in Paraguay. The IAF supports community-led solutions to create opportunities for employment and social integration for migrants and refugees in Paraguay. In the cities of Asuncin, Ciudad del Este, and Encarnacin, our grantee Semillas para la Democracia supports women migrants by providing entrepreneurship training, business incubation services, and seed capital to help migrants start or grow their own microenteprises, with the ultimate goal of improving their economic security and social inclusion in Paraguay. This grant is part of the IAF's commitment to support displaced Venezuelans and communities impacted by the Venezuelan humanitarian crisis.

title.narrative: LA ESCUELA VECINAL, CIUDADANIA & TRABAJO EN TIEMPOS DE COVID 19 EN EL PARAGUAY

description.narrative: The pandemic reduced spaces for citizens'especially migrants from rural communities, young people, and women'to advocate for their rights and promote a more open and transparent government. The IAF supports community-led solutions to raise citizens' voices and engagement in ways that strengthen local governance. Our grantee Federacin de Entidades Vecinalistas del Paraguay (FEDEM) will raise citizens' awareness of their civil and labor rights and provide employment and entrepreneurship skills training in neighborhood associations in four municipalities of the greater Asuncin metropolitan area. FEDEM will strengthen the community social fabric to more effectively address grassroots priorities and promote local government transparency and accountability to help reduce corruption and improve the quality of life of vulnerable people.

title.narrative: A Partnership to Pilot an Indicator Framework for Sustainable Agriculture in Latin America

description.narrative: Farmers are often absent from discussions about how policies and programs impact sustainable agricultural production. At the IAF, we are investing in a regional effort, in conjunction with the University of British Columbia, that will give voice to farmers and directly support them in collecting, analyzing, and presenting data that they can incorporate into their operations to manage their farms more efficiently. Asociacin de Productores Orgnicos (APRO) established the first recognized participatory certification system in Paraguay and is connecting producers directly to consumers to increase farmers incomes and consumers food security. It provides training and technical assistance programs to provide high-quality certified organic products to national and international consumers.The results of this regional project will inform agricultural support organizations, government extension experts, farmer groups, and policy-makers with context-specific data about how to encourage the transition to sustainable agricultural practices to improve food security, enhance farmer livelihoods, and minimize environmental degradation. This is part of the IAF's strategic initiative for sustainable agriculture.

title.narrative: Fortalecimiento de Redes Chaco, Captulo Paraguay

description.narrative: Already-marginalized Indigenous and Creole populations living in a particularly isolated and fragile region of Paraguay are made more vulnerable by the increase in environmental shocks, such as severe drought, forest fires, and rapid deforestation. The IAF supports community-led solutions to create economic opportunity and social inclusion for Indigenous people, women, and youth in Paraguay. Our grantee Sombra de Arbol (SdeA) will support Redes Chaco PY to strengthen the organizational and advocacy capacity of its civil society and grassroots members so that they can develop greater consensus around a comprehensive framework for inclusive and sustainable development of the Paraguayan Chaco.

title.narrative: IMPROVEMENT OF PLATFORM CAPABILITIES: PY ORGANIC

description.narrative: Small farmers in rural Paraguay often lack access to markets to sell their goods, limiting their potential to generate income. The IAF supports community-led approaches to expand economic opportunity. Our grantee partner, Paraguay Orgnico (PY Orgnico), helps small farmer organizations break into and benefit from expanding organic markets. This grant will allow PY Orgnico to extend its efforts on three fronts: train farmers to differentiate their products, connect farmers to potential markets, and strengthen its own organizational capacities. As a result, farmers will be better prepared to meet evolving market requirements and PY Orgnico will be an even stronger partner going forward.

title.narrative: Strengthening a youth network to promote conservation and sustainable development in the Yvytyruzu

description.narrative: Paraguay, with one of the highest deforestation rates in the world, is home to the diverse Yvytyruz reserve. Communities living within the reserve face extreme poverty and are often unaware of the land's protected status, resulting in similarly high rates of deforestation. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to expand economic opportunity and promote sustainable natural resource management. Our grantee partner, Organizacin Paraguaya de Conservacin y Desarrollo Sustentable (OPADES), offers environmental education, leadership, and entrepreneurship training opportunities to youth in the Yvytyruz reserve to bolster environmental stewardship and improve livelihoods.

title.narrative: Gobernanza Territorial Indgena para el Desarrollo Autodeterminado y la Accin Climtica

description.narrative: With Paraguay's Atlantic Forest facing extinction from deforestation and devastating fires, preserving and restoring forest reserves on indigenous lands has become critical. The Mby Guaran community faces ongoing incursions on its constitutionally-granted lands in the Atlantic Forest of the Upper Paran. The COVID-19 pandemic and resulting economic contraction have further increased the pressure on Indigenous Paraguayans to diversify their economic activities while maintaining a sustainable approach to land management. The Federacin para la Autodeterminacin de los Pueblos Indgenas (FAPI) is an association of Paraguayan Indigenous groups that advocates for their territorial rights and supports communities to identify sustainable approaches to managing their territory. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to improving environmental management and strengthening local governance. FAPI will support local Mby Guaran groups to develop and implement a land management plan to protect against forest fires and promote their territorial autonomy.

title.narrative: Committed to end corruption

description.narrative: Ciudad del Este, Paraguay's second largest city, has received more than $12 million in education funding from a national development fund. By engaging actively with the process for allocating those funds, residents of Ciudad del Este can ensure the allocations are distributed in a manner that maximizes their impact. ReAccin, a youth-led organization, works to educate students, parents, and school administrators about the educational funding process. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to engaging citizens, combating corruption, and ensuring sustainable local funding of development initiatives. Through this grant, ReAccin will develop internet-based tools to promote student activism and expand investigative journalism so that Paraguayans better understand funding allocations in their country.

title.narrative: Strengthening the productivity and social enterprise of the Asociacin Ooir

description.narrative: Pesticide runoff contaminates waterways and reduces the productivity of small-scale farms in Paraguay. When farmers cannot grow enough crops to make a living, they may feel pressured to migrate, rent, or sell their land. The IAF supports community-led approaches to sustainable agriculture and income generation. Our grantee, Ooir is supporting farmers to increase production of organic yerba mate, a traditional beverage in Paraguay and neighboring countries, and expand sales both nationally and internationally. Ooir is also diversifying into a new product line of organic medicinal plants, such as stevia and lemon verbena, grown and sold by women smallholder producers.This grant is part of the IAF's Women INvesting in Growth and Security (WINGS) initiative to empower women as business and community leaders.

title.narrative: Fortaleciendo la capacidad de produccin agroecolgica de agricultoras familiares de 3 Distritos del Departamento de San Pedro

description.narrative: Many women smallholder farmers in San Pedro, one of the poorest departments in Paraguay, face the challenge of having to farm with contaminated water and soil and limited access to markets for their products. Local public policies relevant to sustainable agriculture often fail to reflect womens needs or aspirations because they are often excluded from the development of policies. The IAF supports community-led approaches to increase income generation and civic participation. Our grantee Coordinadora Departamental de Mujeres de San Pedro (CDMSP) supports women smallholder producers in adopting sustainable agricultural practices that help them expand food production for consumption and sale. CDMSP also builds women farmers capacity to advocate for their interests with local governments. This grant is part of the IAF's Women INvesting in Growth and Security (WINGS) initiative to empower women as business and community leaders.

title.narrative: Strengthening livelihoods in Indigenous Guarani communities during and after the COVID-19 pandemic.

description.narrative: Indigenous Mbya Guarani communities in Paraguay rely on farming and wage labor as their former hunting and gathering livelihoods became unviable. They experience low levels of socioeconomic development, including food insecurity, that have worsened during the COVID-19 pandemic. The IAF supports community-led approaches to strengthen resilience through sustainable agriculture and income generation. Our grantee Oguasu supports the Mbya Guarani in Paraguay in implementing sustainable agricultural practices and learning skilled trades in order to increase their families' incomes and food security. Oguasu will also foster a network of Indigenous-led organizations across the Mbya Guarani territory, which crosses Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, and Paraguay, to promote topics related to the exercise of human rights and economic inclusion.This grant is part of the IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

Oguasu will also foster a network of Indigenous-led organizations across the Mbya Guarani territory, which crosses Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, and Paraguay, to promote topics related to the exercise of human rights and economic inclusion.This grant is part of the IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

title.narrative: Culture, Empowerment, and Advocacy

description.narrative: Marginalized populations such as the LGBTQ+ community in Paraguay often suffer discrimination, human rights violations, and social exclusion. The IAF supports community-led solutions to protecting human rights and promoting non-discrimination. IAF grantee partner Aireana will raise awareness of LGBTQ+ human rights in Paraguay, promote social inclusion, and reduce violence and discrimination. Aireana will carry out a series of events and dialogues across vulnerable populations, including farmers, young people, and Indigenous people.

title.narrative: Revitalization of Indigenous Culture

description.narrative: Grupo Sunu (Sunu) will work with indigenous Ava Guaran, Angait Maskoy and Chamacoco Paraguayans in the departments of Canindey, Presidente Hayes and Alto Paraguay to promote their cultural identity, their understanding of their rights as indigenous peoples, and economic, social and cultural development. The project will directly benefit 3,600 indigenous Paraguayans in the communities served and will indirectly benefit 6,000 other indigenous Paraguayans.

title.narrative: Revitalization of Indigenous Culture

description.narrative: Grupo Sun (Sun), $143,290 over 18 months Sun will work to improve food security in Angait and Av Guaran indigenous communities by training residents in gardening and animal husbandry and to reconcile modern and traditional practices directed at resolving internal conflicts and protecting rights. The experience will be documented and shared with government agencies, educational centers and civil society organizations in an effort to further the awareness of the rights and culture expressions of indigenous Paraguayans and enable their exercise.

title.narrative: Strengthening the production and marketing capabilities with a rights based approach of vulnerable rural populations in southern Paraguay

description.narrative: CECTEC will provide technical assistance and training to residents of six rural communities who were resettled pursuant to Paraguay's agrarian reform program. This includes working with them to identify and support their development priorities. The project is expected to benefit 250 families in the department of Itapa. With additional funds, CECTEC will work with at least three new resettlement communities to strengthen the leadership and advocacy skills necessary for effective engagement with local authorities; will explore with the communities the option of supplying goods to government agencies based on new official policies; and will develop the organic production of a farmer association as well as its management and member services related to credit, processing and marketing.

title.narrative: Consolidation of the marketer ECOAGRO of the Organic Producers Association of Paraguay.

description.narrative: Asociacin de Productores Orgnicos (APRO) will increase incomes and improve the quality of life of approximately 290 families by strengthening its capacity to market and sell fresh and processed agricultural products. It will also provide technical assistance and training on organic production. APRO's goals are to increase the association's sales volume, diversify and expand its product base to include new value- added products and grow organic fruits and vegetables off- season. The project will directly benefit 1000 individuals as well as another 1820 indirectly. APRO will use additional funds to increase its sales through improvements to its processing facilities that meet government standards. It will also develop procedures for certifying its livestock as organic and work to obtain government approval of its system for application nationwide.

title.narrative: Artistic Microenterprise Development

description.narrative: FAT will strengthen the artistic and organizational capacity of approximately 50 young people who make up the Stela Marys theater group. The theater group is made up of members from five greater Asuncin area public high schools and is housed at the Stela Marys high school. It will train the young people how to administer, market, and organize a community cultural center as well as assist them in obtaining legal status for the center. There are two main goals: 1.) Build the capacity of the students to run a community cultural center as a non-profit community foundation that helps attract resources to address the needs in the community; and 2.) transform the community theater group so that it can expand its offering of artistic services that will generate income for its members and provide additional resources to invest in their communities.

title.narrative: Disability Rights

description.narrative: Fundacin Saraki (Saraki) will work with 50 grassroots and nongovernmental organizations in 11 departments to develop leadership and advocacy skills toward the enforcement of laws protecting the rights of Paraguayans with disabilities including the right to equal opportunity in employment. The coalition will offer training in job skills and will also educate the public. The project is expected to benefit 1960 Paraguayans directly and 900000 indirectly.

title.narrative: Disability Rights

description.narrative: Fundacin Saraki (Saraki) will work with approximately 70 disability rights grassroots groups and nongovernmental organizations (NGO) in about 14 departments and Asuncion. It will build NGO and grassroots groups' leadership capacity and increase the number of people with disabilities (PwD) leading disabled people's organizations in Paraguay. Saraki will also work to strengthen advocacy and effective participation in the implementation of several new laws in areas such as employment and accessibility and the targets, indicators and intermediate deadline for measuring achievement of the targets for the 2015- 2030 National Disability Plan. It will also develop a leadership training program for PwDs and other community leaders committed to promoting disability rights in their municipality. Saraki will also document and disseminate learning from its work relevant for civil society and disability sectors in Paraguay and throughout Latin America.

The coalition will offer training in job skills and will also educate the public. The project is expected to benefit 1,960 Paraguayans directly and 900,000 indirectly.

title.narrative: Training in Agroecologic al Culture for the Rooting of the Indigenous Pa Tavytera of the Amamabay

description.narrative: Asociacin Pa Tavytera RekoPave in Paraguay will work with 17 indigenous communities in Northern Paraguay to improve their agricultural production and cultivation of traditional seeds to become more food secure, protect their local environment, strengthen their cultural identity, and enhance the associations ability to represent its interests and advocate for its rights under Paraguayan law. Approximately 1,500 people will benefit directly and 5,200 people will benefit indirectly.

title.narrative: Training in Agroecologic al Culture for the Rooting of the Indigenous Pa Tavytera of the Amamabay

title.narrative: Local Youth Councils Advocating for the participation of Youth in the Central Department

description.narrative: Fundacin Casa de la Juventud (CdJ) will bolster a youth network in 12 municipalities in Paraguay's Central department and expand it to eight municipalities in the country's interior to advocate for their rights, create safe spaces to interact, and propose solutions that positively impact them and their communities. CdJ will also train around 100 youth in skills like leadership and communications, increasing their employability and ability to productively contribute to society. About 150 young people will benefit directly and another 14,000 indirectly.

title.narrative: United for Sustainable Development

description.narrative: Alter Vida (Alter Vida) will work in tandem with the small dairy cooperative Ciervo Cu to increase their members' income by improving their production, their ability to negotiate with their clients for better prices and their advocacy to their local government for better services. The members will also begin the transition from conventional to agroecological" practices that improve food security and protect the environment. The project will benefit 500 Paraguayans directly and another 1500 indirectly.

title.narrative: Territorial Coordination of Indigenous Communities Nivacle- Manjui the Pilcomayo River Region (Paraguayan Chaco).

description.narrative: Tierra Libre - Instituto Social y Ambiental (Tierra Libre - ISA) will work with 12 Nivacle and Manjui communities in the Rio Pilcomayo region of the Paraguayan Chaco. Its training should enable residents to exercise their rights as indigenous Paraguayans, develop their organizations, secure their food supply, access water resources, and address the effects of climate change. Approximately 360 Nivacle and Manjui Paraguayans should benefit directly and another 3,200 indirectly.

title.narrative: Integrated System for Sustainable Horticultural Production

description.narrative: Tierra Nueva Asociacin Civil (TN) will work with four associations of farmers to develop the organizations, improve production through the application of agroecological practices and boost marketing via stronger alliances with the private and public sectors. The program includes the introduction of biodigester technology to aid in the production of organic fertilizer and biofuel and the installation of irrigation systems and greenhouses to further aid with diversification. Some 250 Paraguayans should benefit directly and another 1,000 indirectly.

title.narrative: Integrated System for Sustainable horticultural Production

description.narrative: Tierra Nueva Asociacin Civil in Paraguay (TN). TN will work with four associations of farmers to develop the organizations, improve production through the application of agroecological practices and boost marketing via stronger alliances with the private and public sectors. The program includes the introduction of biodigester technology to aid in the production of organic fertilizer and biofuel and the installation of irrigation systems and greenhouses to further aid with diversification. Some 250 Paraguayans should benefit directly and another 1,000 indirectly.

title.narrative: Strengthening organizations and vindicating rights of Indigenous and Creole peoples in the Paraguayan Chaco

description.narrative: Asociacin Sombra de rbol in Paraguay (ASdeA). ASdeA will provide technical assistance and training that enables two indigenous communities and a creole producer association in the Paraguayan Chaco to develop a more reliable food supply and the ability to advocate for their interests, defend their rights to their territory, practice their culture, increase awareness of their contributions to Paraguayan society, participate in local and regional networks, and organize more effectively. The work will benefit 850 Paraguayans directly and 10,500 indirectly.

title.narrative: Artisan crafts as dignified work for indigenous women of the Paraguayan Chaco.

description.narrative: Mingar Asociacin para el Desarrollo Sustentable (Mingar) will offer eight organizations of indigenous artisans training and technical assistance toward improving their members' handicraft production and marketing, developing public awareness of Paraguays indigenous heritage and creating opportunities for the growth of community tourism. It will also facilitate dialogue among artisans of various ethnicities, civil society organizations and the public sector on how best to take advantage of the crafts traditions to improve the quality of life of indigenous communities. The work will benefit 320 artisans directly and another 1,600 Paraguayans indirectly.

title.narrative: Building OCRC's organization al capacity through training in agricultural production and young people in the department of Concepcion.

description.narrative: Organizacin Campesina Regional de Concepcin (OCRC) will develop and implement a long- term organizational plan to strengthen its capacity as a grassroots organization by serving as a training center to meet the needs of its members. The project will also help members develop advocacy skills and build more effective relationships to gather support for community-led sustainable local development initiatives from departmental and municipal governments and other public entities. OCRC will provide technical assistance to member families on improving soil fertility and adopting agroecological practices to improve their food security. It will also provide vocational training for youth in motorcycle repair and maintenance. Approximately 450 people will benefit directly and 1350 will benefit indirectly from the project.

title.narrative: Strengthen the Union of Students of Paraguay Centers UNEPY, boosting their impact on the public debate.

description.narrative: Centro de Estudios y Educacin Popular Germinal (CEEPG) will provide technical assistance and training to members of the Unin Nacional de Centros de Estudiantes del Paraguay - Unepy a national network of high school student councils and to Asociacin UNEPY an association representing former members of the network. The support will aim to develop the organizational fundraising and technical capabilities of these organizations so that they may become better advocates for educational and student rights. Young Paraguayans will gain practical knowledge and experience in democratic processes catalyzing a culture of participation that will stimulate increased participation in elections and public policy. Approximately 1200 young people will benefit directly and 50000 more indirectly. ..

title.narrative: Improving food security and income through organic agriculture, animal husbandry, and beekeeping in Itapa

description.narrative: ESCAP will work with families in Natalio and Yatytay in Itapa department of southeast Paraguay to improve their food security and income through organic gardens and enhanced dairy cattle poultry and honey production. Farmers will diversify their production and improve market access through training and upgrades to facilities to store their goods while in transit to fairs for examples. Project activities will also strengthen ESCAP's management skills to help it help it function more efficiently and effectively. ESCAP will also work with a regional alliance of organizations it is part of to organize training workshops to increase its members' fundraising and networking skills and improve overall operations. ESCAP will also work through its member organizations to help install water systems in two communities to increase access to potable water. The grant will benefit 384 individuals directly and another 5,200 individuals indirectly.

description.narrative: Asociacin Sombra de rbol (ASdeA) will work with indigenous and creole communities in the remote Paraguayan Chaco? a region challenged with extreme poverty a lack of government presence and harsh environment - to improve their livelihoods and food security through smallholder agricultural practices and the promotion and strengthening of their cultural heritage. Approximately 2175 people will benefit directly and 10100 indirectly.

title.narrative: Organizational strengthening to promote organic agriculture as a means for improving livelihoods in Paraguay

description.narrative: Asociacin Paraguay Orgnico (PY Orgnico) will develop a strategic plan conduct outreach activities and implement studies to increase its capacity to serve the members of its national network and to promote smallholder organic agriculture in Paraguay. PY Orgnico will also provide technical assistance to smallholder organic producers to help them improve production marketing and sales of organic products. About 2800 people will benefit directly and nearly 14000 indirectly.

title.narrative: Improvement of agroecological production and commercialization, training of young people and women for labor insertion in the department of Concepcin.

description.narrative: Paraguays Concepcin Department is one of the countrys poorest, and illicit activities and violence often hinder economic and community development. Organizacin Campesina Regional de Concepcin (OCRC) provides technical assistance to smallholder organic farmers and job and leadership training to young people and women. Its activities help to improve food security and income generation potential. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in Paraguay.

title.narrative: IMPROVEMENT OF PLATFORM CAPABILITIES: PY ORGANIC

description.narrative: Small farmers in rural Paraguay often lack access to markets to sell their goods, limiting their potential to generate income. The IAF supports community-led approaches to expand economic opportunity. Our grantee partner, Paraguay Orgnico (PY Orgnico), helps small farmer organizations break into and benefit from expanding organic markets. This grant will allow PY Orgnico to extend its efforts on three fronts: train farmers to differentiate their products, connect farmers to potential markets, and strengthen its own organizational capacities. As a result, farmers will be better prepared to meet evolving market requirements and PY Orgnico will be an even stronger partner going forward..

title.narrative: Strengthening of the Paraguayan Organization of Conservation and Sustainable Development - OPADES and expansion of the Program of Volunteers in Protected Areas to the Reserve of Managed Resources Yvytyruz, Dpto. Del Guaira

description.narrative: Paraguay, with one of the highest deforestation rates in the world, is home to the diverse Yvytyruz reserve. Communities living within the reserve face extreme poverty and are often unaware of the lands protected status, resulting in similarly high rates of deforestation. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to expand economic opportunity and promote sustainable natural resource management. Our grantee partner, Organizacin Paraguaya de Conservacin y Desarrollo Sustentable (OPADES), offers environmental education, leadership, and entrepreneurship training opportunities to youth in the Yvytyruz reserve to bolster environmental stewardship and improve livelihoods.
